    • Constructor Detail

      • Statement

        public Statement(java.lang.String statement,
                 int lineNumber)
          throws TypeDoesNotExistException,
                 IncompatibleVariableTypesException,
                 VariableAlreadyDeclaredException
        Create a new Statement
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to execute
        lineNumber - The statement's line number
        Throws:
        TypeDoesNotExistException - If the statement tries to declare a variable with an invalid type
        IncompatibleVariableTypesException - If the statement tries to set a variable to an unsupported type
        VariableAlreadyDeclaredException - If the statement tries to declare a variable name already taken
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Statement

      • runStatement

                                    throws DonkeyException,
                                           javax.script.ScriptException
        Run the Statement
        Returns:
        The object that the statement/method returns, or null if there is no return
        Throws:
        DonkeyException - If something goes wrong
        javax.script.ScriptException - If a math expression is invalid

      • runBlock

        public final void runBlock(boolean run)
                    throws javax.script.ScriptException,
                           DonkeyException
        Run the block that the statement controls
        Parameters:
        run - Whether to run the contents of the block or not
        Throws:
        DonkeyException - If there's an error in the Donkey code
        javax.script.ScriptException - If an error happens in the script
        Since:
        1.0

      • runBlock

        public final void runBlock(boolean run,
                           boolean force)
                    throws javax.script.ScriptException,
                           DonkeyException
        Run the block that the statement controls
        Parameters:
        run - Whether to run the contents of the block or not
        force - If run is on, then force the statements to run
        Throws:
        DonkeyException - If there's an error in the Donkey code
        javax.script.ScriptException - If an error happens in the script
        Since:
        1.0

      • destroyEverythingAfterLastInstanceOf

        public static java.lang.String destroyEverythingAfterLastInstanceOf(java.lang.String string,
                                                                    java.lang.String destroy)
        Destroy every character after the last instance of a certain string, including that string. Equivilant to calling destroyEverythingAfterLastInstanceOf(String, String, true)
        Parameters:
        string - The string to parse
        destroy - The string that is removed along with everything after it
        Returns:
        The parsed string
        Since:
        1.0

      • destroyEverythingAfterLastInstanceOf

        public static java.lang.String destroyEverythingAfterLastInstanceOf(java.lang.String string,
                                                                    java.lang.String destroy,
                                                                    boolean inclusive)
        Destroy every character after the last instance of a certain string.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to parse
        destroy - The string that removes everything after it
        inclusive - Whether to remove the destroy string along with everything after it.
        Returns:
        The parsed string
        Since:
        1.0
